channel.title: JBoss Issue Tracker
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ENTESB-5965] on EAP, MBean to update routes is not working
item.description:
The issue occurs only on EAP.

!ENTRY org.fusesource.ide.foundation.ui 4 0 2016-08-10 09:08:20.243
 
!MESSAGE <no message>

item.summary: on EAP, MBean to update routes is not working

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
it seems to be related to this issue: https://access.redhat.com/solutions/646363

Edit:

  • The proposed workaround is not working
  • the file jboss-deployment-structure.xml need to be placed in WEB-INF folder for war deployment
What's the trigger for the 'Camel' view to appear under the server connections tree? I have two contexts deployed to EAP but it wont show.

James Netherton i don't understand your question.

I have this:

The camel part in the subtree appears automatically: just need to have Fuse Tooling installed and Fuse on EAP configured.

Another way would be that after you deployed a camel route, if you use a JConsole to call the MBean you will have the error too. I'm pretty sure that it will reproduce the issue.

Think I know what the issue is. It's similar in nature to this:

https://github.com/wildfly-extras/wildfly-camel/issues/608

WildFly-Camel has a some logic to ensure that JAXB is initialised properly and sets a ModelJAXBContextFactory on the created camel context:

https://github.com/jboss-fuse/wildfly-camel/blob/2.4-redhat/subsystem/src/main/java/org/wildfly/extension/camel/handler/ModelJAXBContextFactoryWrapperHandler.java

Unfortunately with camel-spring, this good work is undone within the SpringCamelContext constructor, where it proceeds to overwrite the JAXBContextFactory with its own SpringModelJAXBContextFactory. If I replace the SpringModelJAXBContextFactory instance with the original Factory created by the camel subsystem, the addOrUpdateRoutesFromXml invocation seems to work fine.

Now I need to work out what the best fix for this is.

I fixed this in Camel for Fuse 6.3 in this commit:

https://github.com/jboss-fuse/camel/commit/1aa40980f82d2f714c074e098187033675bff886

Simple reproducer:
Create file test-camel-context.xml in $FUSE_EAP_HOME/standalone/deployments:

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
 
<beans xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans"
 
	xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
 
	xsi:schemaLocation="
 
		http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans/spring-beans-3.0.xsd
 
		http://camel.apache.org/schema/spring http://camel.apache.org/schema/spring/camel-spring.xsd">
 
 
 
	<camelContext id="test-context" xmlns="http://camel.apache.org/schema/spring">
 
		<route id="test-route">
 
			<from uri="timer://foo?period=2000"/>
 
			<log message="Hello World"/>
 
		</route>
 
	</camelContext>
 
</beans>

Use jconsole and run method addOrUpdateRoutesFromXml with the following content:

<routes id="myRoute" xmlns="http://camel.apache.org/schema/spring">
 
  <route id="test-route">
 
    <from uri="timer://foo?period=2000"/>
 
    <log message="Hello Martin"/>
 
  </route>
 
</routes>

Expected output:

15:20:39,044 INFO  [test-route] (Camel (test-context) thread #5 - timer://foo) Hello World
 
15:20:41,044 INFO  [test-route] (Camel (test-context) thread #5 - timer://foo) Hello World
 
15:20:43,044 INFO  [test-route] (Camel (test-context) thread #5 - timer://foo) Hello World
 
15:20:45,045 INFO  [test-route] (Camel (test-context) thread #5 - timer://foo) Hello World
 
15:20:45,670 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy] (RMI TCP Connection(10)-127.0.0.1) Starting to graceful shutdown 1 routes (timeout 300 seconds)
 
15:20:45,671 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy] (Camel (test-context) thread #6 - ShutdownTask) Route: test-route shutdown complete, was consuming from: Endpoint[timer://foo?period=2000]
 
15:20:45,672 INFO  [org.apache.camel.impl.DefaultShutdownStrategy] (RMI TCP Connection(10)-127.0.0.1) Graceful shutdown of 1 routes completed in 0 seconds
 
15:20:45,672 INFO  [org.apache.camel.spring.SpringCamelContext] (RMI TCP Connection(10)-127.0.0.1) Route: test-route is stopped, was consuming from: Endpoint[timer://foo?period=2000]
 
15:20:45,674 INFO  [org.apache.camel.spring.SpringCamelContext] (RMI TCP Connection(10)-127.0.0.1) Route: test-route is shutdown and removed, was consuming from: Endpoint[timer://foo?period=2000]
 
15:20:45,695 INFO  [org.apache.camel.spring.SpringCamelContext] (RMI TCP Connection(10)-127.0.0.1) Route: test-route started and consuming from: Endpoint[timer://foo?period=2000]
 
15:20:46,696 INFO  [test-route] (Camel (test-context) thread #7 - timer://foo) Hello Martin
 
15:20:48,696 INFO  [test-route] (Camel (test-context) thread #7 - timer://foo) Hello Martin
 
15:20:50,696 INFO  [test-route] (Camel (test-context) thread #7 - timer://foo) Hello Martin

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue:
• configure Fuse on EAP 6.4.0
  • create a route compatible for EAP (you can use the archetype wildfly-camel)
  • deploy it
  • try to call addOrUpdateRoutesFromXml CamelContextMBean
    • from Fuse Tooling:
      • click on Edit routes
      • modify diagram
      • save
